alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Kenedy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 21 at 4:24AM CST until January 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Significant icing occurring. Very cold wind chills expected. The ice will result in difficult travel conditions, including during the morning commute. Additional ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch are expected. Expect wind chills to range from 20 to 25 degrees. * WHERE...Portions of Deep South Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 12 PM today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 12 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 30 minutes to exposed skin.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of ice are occurring This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
